front.title: Combiner function for hybrid key encapsulation mechanisms (Hybrid KEMs)

abstract.t: The migration to post-quantum cryptography often calls for performing multiple key encapsulations in parallel and then combining their outputs to derive a single shared secret. This document defines a flexible multi-share KEM combiner to join an arbitrary number of key shares, that is a multi-PRF compatible with NIST SP 800-56Cr2 [SP800-56C]. The combiner defined here is CCA- secure as long as at least one of the ingredient KEMs is.
